AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Magistrate Judge: judge who issued a report and recommendation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: border patrol agency with agents working near Farm-to-Market Road 2050, noticing drop-offs and recognizing most vehicles on the road; aware of local traffic patterns and vehicle characteristics
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Police Department: conducted a traffic stop of Defendant IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and cooperated with United States Border Patrol during the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: heard motions to suppress evidence obtained from the vehicle stops and arrests of Defendants RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 59: highway connected by Farm-to-Market Road 2050, part of a common smuggling route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint: location where Agent Trevino was stationed and conducted inspections; checkpoint avoided by smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint Building: building where Agent Trevino processed undocumented individuals; location of processing activities
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol Station Parking Lot: parking lot adjacent to the Freer immigration checkpoint; nearby area where vehicles turned southbound onto Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge: agent who followed the vehicles and made observations, noting suspicious behavior of passengers in the white Malibu sedan
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Ignaci: defendant associated with the black Dodge pickup truck; provided inconsistent information about vehicle ownership
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road where Agent Trevino encountered suspicious vehicles and raised his suspicions due to its unusual route for out-of-town vehicles, noting that the white Malibu sedan was going on and off this road multiple times
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville Checkpoint: checkpoint on U.S. Highway 359 avoided by smugglers; mentioned by Defendant as the starting point of his travel
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: highway connecting to Houston or San Antonio, used by smugglers after avoiding checkpoints; accessible via San Pablo Road and Santo Nino Road; location of the traffic stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 359: highway connected by Farm-to-Market Road 2050, part of an alternative route used by smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Immigration Checkpoint and Hebbron: checkpoints avoided by smugglers using routes via Farm-to-Market Road 2050, U.S. Highway 59, and U.S. Highway 359
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth: specific location of Hertz rental car company where vehicles are registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett Road: dirt road intersecting Farm-to-Market Road 2050, approximately five to six miles south of the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: road where the Moglia ranch house and Stag ranch trailer are located, with unknown land ownership
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moglia Ranch House: ranch house located near San Pablo Road, ownership unknown to Agent Trevino
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stag Ranch Trailer: trailer located near San Pablo Road, ownership unknown to Agent Trevino
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santo Nino Road: also known as Dinn Ranch, extends east from Farm-to-Market Road 2050; provides access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Dinn Ranch: also known as Santo Nino Road, extends east from Farm-to-Market Road 2050; provides access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reyes: conducted a traffic stop of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., noticed he was nervous and shaking during the interaction; issued a citation and impounded the black Dodge pickup truck due to unclear ownership and lack of insurance information
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 35: most direct highway to Dallas, Texas or San Antonio from the area where Agent Trevino encountered the suspicious vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: location of the border patrol operations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Dallas, Texas: city where the rental car was registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Antonio: city mentioned as a reference point for the location of Corinth, Texas and a potential destination for smuggled individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol Agent Hugo B: conducted an interrogation of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and had sufficient information to arrest him on the spot once he arrived at the traffic stop on Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: conducted a traffic stop of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., noticed he was nervous and shaking during the interaction; issued a citation and impounded the black Dodge pickup truck due to unclear ownership and lack of insurance information; informed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. that he needed to wait for the United States Border Patrol agents to arrive
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: received information regarding attempted alien smuggling events; conducted interviews at the Freer immigration checkpoint; involved in the prosecution of individuals and bears the burden of proving that stops were constitutional
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Government: prohibits unreasonable searches and seizures, involved in the prosecution of individuals and bears the burden of proving that stops were constitutional; has a court system including the Fifth Circuit
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: court that does not adhere to a bright line rule regarding proximity to the Mexico border; previously held that certain factors can add to reasonable suspicion, such as vehicle registration and route taken; addressed similar cases involving tandem vehicles and probable cause for arrest; noted that the order of vehicles in a smuggling venture is not significant
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 277: highway with a checkpoint that can be avoided by taking Ranch Road 2523 north to Highway 377
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 377: highway that can be used to avoid the checkpoint on Highway 277 by taking Ranch Road 2523 north to Highway 377
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ranch Road 2523: road that can be used to avoid the checkpoint on Highway 277 by taking it north to Highway 377
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 85: a common smuggling route that avoids immigration checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country with lawful bounds for stops, governing principles for traffic stops and arrests
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court of the United States: refused to authorize investigative interrogations at law enforcement stations on less than probable cause or consent
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court: governing body for traffic stops and arrests, applying principles set out in Terry
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Judge: judge who conducts independent review of motions to suppress and reviews the findings, conclusions, and recommendations of the Magistrate Judge
defendant associated with the white Malibu sedan
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ford Motor Company: a truck manufacturer whose vehicles are commonly used by oil companies and encountered by Agent Trevino during his inspections
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Corinth, Texas: location where the black Dodge pickup truck was registered
defendant associated with the black Dodge pickup truck
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.J. Scott Hacker: does not consider the fact that the black Dodge pickup truck was riding low to contribute to the reasonable suspicion for the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation: prepared district traffic maps of Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and U.S. Highway 59, indicating traffic flow data primarily collected and determined by the Transportation, Planning, and Programming Division in Austin; has a Laredo Division with a Director of Transportation, Planning and Development
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation, Tran: collects and determines traffic flow data for district traffic maps
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation, Lare: has a Director of Transportation, Planning and Development who testified about the accuracy of traffic flow data
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Rental Car Company: rental car company whose vehicles are used by smugglers to avoid losing personal vehicles in case of getting caught
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Bruni, Texas: location at the southern terminus of Farm-to-Market Road 2050 that could have been reached via U.S. Highway 359 for a more direct route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ranchitos Las Lomas: starting point of the journey on U.S. Highway 59 where a more direct route to Bruni would be Farm-to-Market Road 2895 instead of Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2895: alternative farm-to-market road that would have been a more direct route to Bruni from Ranchitos Las Lomas on U.S. Highway 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: vehicle involved in the smuggling operation, with passengers exhibiting suspicious behavior such as sitting stiff and not communicating with each other
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge pickup truck: vehicle that appeared to be used for transporting illegal aliens, with a camper and registered to someone in Corinth, Texas; was riding low and had half of its passengers wearing caps
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan and black Dodge picku: vehicles involved in the smuggling operation; used to transport undocumented individuals and exhibited suspicious behavior such as going on and off Farm-to-Market Road 2050 multiple times
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Houston: city mentioned as a potential destination for smuggled individuals
